channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-8018] Add "Flaky Testcase Detector" tool into dev-tools
item.description:
jenkins-tools
=============

A tool which pulls test case results from Jenkins server. It displays a union of failed test cases
from the last 15(by default and actual number of jobs can be less depending on availablity) runs
recorded in Jenkins sever and track how each of them are performed for all the last 15 runs(passed,
not run or failed)

Pre-requirement(run under folder ./dev-support/jenkins-tools)
Please download jenkins-client from https://github.com/cosmin/jenkins-client
1) git clone git://github.com/cosmin/jenkins-client.git
2) make sure the dependency jenkins-client version in ./buildstats/pom.xml matches the
downloaded jenkins-client(current value is 0.1.6-SNAPSHOT)

Build command(run under folder jenkins-tools):


       mvn clean package

Usage are: 


       java -jar ./buildstats/target/buildstats.jar <Jenkins HTTP URL> <Job Name> [number of last most recent jobs to check]

Sample commands are:


       java -jar ./buildstats/target/buildstats.jar https://builds.apache.org HBase-TRUNK

Sample output(where 1 means "PASSED", 0 means "NOT RUN AT ALL", -1 means "FAILED"):

Failed Test Cases Stats 4360 4361 4362 4363 4364 4365 4366 4367 4368 4369
========================================================
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.backup.testhfilearchiving.testcleaningrace 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 1 -1 0
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.migration.testnamespaceupgrade.testrenameusingsnapshots 1 1 1 -1 0 1 1 1 1 1

Skipped Test Cases Stats
======= 4360 skipped(Or don't have) following test suites =======
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.replication.testreplicationkillmasterrscompressed
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfilessplitrecovery
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfiles
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testmapreduceexamples
======= 4361 skipped(Or don't have) following test suites =======
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfilessplitrecovery
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfiles
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testmapreduceexamples
======= 4362 skipped(Or don't have) following test suites =======
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfilessplitrecovery
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfiles
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testmapreduceexamples
======= 4363 skipped(Or don't have) following test suites =======
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfilessplitrecovery
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testsecureloadincrementalhfiles
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testmapreduceexamples
======= 4368 skipped(Or don't have) following test suites =======
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.testadmin
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.client.testclonesnapshotfromclient
org.apache.hadoop.hbase.mapreduce.testmapreduceexamples
item.summary: Add "Flaky Testcase Detector" tool into dev-tools

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: The patch includes a wrapper script flaky-test-detector.sh which uses the jar we pre-compiled. A user can build her/his own buildstats.jar by following instructions documented in ./jenkins-tools/README.md

Pre-requirement

       Please download jenkins-client from https://github.com/jeffreyz88/jenkins-tools/tree/master/jenkins-client and put folder jenkins-client under jenkins-tools.

Is this jenkins-client on your repo patched from the upstream version? Can we just pull it in as a dependency instead of downloading it manually?

Usage are: 



        java -jar ./buildstats/target/buildstats.jar <Jenkins HTTP URL> <Job Name> [number of last most recent jobs to check]

How about bundling a launch script that builds the classpath for the user?

For background, building this jar in every build, and committing the slightly modified code for the jenkins java client seemed a unnecessary for this simple tool. So, I suggested we host the already built jar under people.apache.org for now. We can definitely change this if unacceptable.

A couple of comments:

  • Please change these: 
    
<groupId>com.hortonworks</groupId>

<groupId>buildstats</groupId>

    to org.apache.hbase.

  • Add some documentation of why we need the modified jenkins client under your github repo, and how to build it.
  • Do we need the junit dependency?

Nick Dimiduk, Enis Soztutar Thanks for the reviewing. I changed the tool a little bit so I only relies on the code on https://github.com/cosmin/jenkins-client without my custom code.
Since the jenkins-client compiled jar isn't in any public maven repository, I documented to download the client from git hub in README.md.

I also incorporated Enis two comments on the pom.xml in the v1 patch.

Thanks.

This file: dev-support/jenkins-tools/pom.xml needs a copyright header.

Pre-requirement(run under folder jenkins-tools) => Is this still needed?

Rethinking about following, maybe we should not do this, and have it so that the user has to run mvn package in buildstats before calling the .sh script. 


JAR_URL=http://people.apache.org/~enis/buildstats.jar

-1 overall. Here are the results of testing the latest attachment
http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12579629/hbase-8018-v1.patch
against trunk revision .

+1 @author. The patch does not contain any @author tags.

+1 tests included. The patch appears to include 6 new or modified tests.

+1 hadoop1.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 1.0 profile.

+1 hadoop2.0. The patch compiles against the hadoop 2.0 profile.

+1 javadoc. The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

+1 javac. The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

+1 findbugs. The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

-1 release audit. The applied patch generated 2 release audit warnings (more than the trunk's current 0 warnings).

-1 lineLengths. The patch introduces lines longer than 100

+1 site. The mvn site goal succeeds with this patch.

+1 core tests. The patch passed unit tests in .

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//testReport/
Release audit warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/patchReleaseAuditProblems.txt
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-prefix-tree.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-client.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-common.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-protocol.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-server.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop1-compat.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-examples.html
Findbugs warnings: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//artifact/trunk/patchprocess/newPatchFindbugsWarningshbase-hadoop-compat.html
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HBASE-Build/5808//console

This message is automatically generated.
Incorporated Enis Soztutar comments and added the support to dump skipped test suites from last N runs(N is a user specified command line argument)

This message is automatically generated.

I've started using this tool. It saves me a bunch of copy-paste/grep/sort/compare. Very nice. Thanks for doing it Jeffrey Zhong. We should commit it? If so, make the formatting same as it is for rest of codebase on commit? You want to change the groupid here <groupId>com.hortonworks</groupId> to org.apache.hbase if you are going to commit it here? The patch is a bit odd in that it put the dir at top-level and not under dev-tools. Nice one.
Thanks Stack for trying the tool out. I incorporated your comments in v3 patch. The tool is put under folder dev-support.

+1 on commit. The formatting is still off but can fix another time. Tool is needed now. Thanks Jeffrey Zhong

I reformatted the code as the v4 patch.

Integrated the v4 patch into 0.95 and trunk branch. Thanks Stack, Enis Soztutar and Nick Dimiduk for reviews!

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: Tool that looks at jenkins builds and identifies flakey tests or tests that are 'invisibles' -- not mentioned in the test listing but that nonetheless cause the build to fail. See the README.md under dev-tools/jenkins-tools for how to build and use.
